reporter_caption.center: HAAKENSEN v. BURGESS SULPHITE FIBRE CO., 77 N.H. 588 (1913)

caption.center: JULIUS HAAKENSEN v. BURGESS SULPHITE FIBRE CO.

opinion.posture: CASE, for personal injuries. Trial by jury and verdict for the plaintiff. Transferred from the September term, 1912, of the superior court by Chamberlin, J., on the defendants' exception to the denial of a motion for the direction of a verdict in their favor.
opinion.attorneys:
Matthew J. Ryan and Rich Marble (Mr. Ryan orally), for the plaintiff.
Drew, Shurtleff Morris and Sullivan Daley (Mr. Morris orally), for the defendants.
opinion.opinion_text:
It was held when this case was here before (Haakensen v. Company,76 N.H. 443) that there was evidence for the jury; and as there is now more evidence for the plaintiff, the defendants' motion for a directed verdict was properly denied.
Exception overruled.
All concurred.
